blocks.value: Mark was a convert and disciple of St. Peter. It is most probable that Mark was present with Our Lord during His public ministry. There is also the belief that Mark's mother was a friend of Jesus and the apostles.

It is generally conceded that the Gospel According to Saint Mark was written by Mark under the guidance of St. Peter. When we read Mark's gospel, we can hear St. Peter speaking through Mark's words. St. Mark wrote his Gospel in Greek, sometime between A.D. 50-70. Most scholars believe Mark's Gospel was the first Gospel account written and that both Matthew and Luke used Mark's Gospel in the writing of their own Gospel accounts.

Following Peter's death in the mid-60's A.D., Mark was sent to Alexandria, Egypt by the other apostles and evangelized the region. In Alexandria, St. Mark founded the Church. Mark was eventually martyred in Alexandria. His Feastday is April 25.
